description:
Title

Merchandising Coordinator

Salary Range

The anticipated base salary range for this position is $60,000 to $67,000 annually. Exact salary depends on several factors such as experience, skills, and budget. Salary range may vary based on geographic location.

Location

Los Angeles, CA

Reporting Structure

The Merchandising Coordinator reports directly to the VP, Merchandising.

What You’ll Be Responsible For

  • Assist in the development of price tiers and pricing architecture to guide Design in furthering the women’s and women’s line
  • Assist in the creation and implementation of seasonal line plans by delivery and style/SKU to achieve business strategies
  • Assist in the partnership with merchandising and design to build a balanced line based on empirical data and sales analyses, as well as trend and brand awareness
  • Track and monitor key items and growth opportunities by category and style
  • Track wholesale and retail price points based on margin targets and perceived price value
  • Support the head of Merch and merchants to prepare for key meetings by gathering data, building presentations, and other tasks assigned
  • Communicate cross-functionally to bridge Design, Sales, Product Development, and Production to ensure cohesive processes
  • Shop the market to be aware of trends, competitive price positioning, and market share
  • Assist in creating and maintaining weekly/monthly cross-functional reporting tools
  • Assist in managing and reconciling on-order reporting
  • Manage and track the flow of samples as it pertains to in-line and photo samples

What You’ll Bring

  • Effective Collaboration
  • Learning Agility
  • Prioritization

Qualifications/Experience We’re Looking For

  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • Must have a minimum of two (2) years of relevant merchandising experience
  • Must have strong organizational skills and be detail-oriented
  • Must have excellent interpersonal skills and ability to support a team environment
  • Must have awareness of trends, competitive price positioning, and market share
  • Must have excellent time management skills
  • Must have very strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel
  • Must have exceptional analytical skills
  • Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Must have proven ability to work with cross-functional teams

Benefits At Vince

  • Robust healthcare options for medical, dental, vision, flexible spending, and health savings account with employer funding
  • 401(k) with employer match
  • Generous paid time off plans for vacation, sick, and personal, volunteer time, as well as company holidays
  • Hybrid and flexible work options available for roles that can be done remotely
  • Clothing allowance & merchandise discounts
  • $600 annual gym reimbursement
  • Monthly data/phone stipend for eligible roles
  • Mental health support tools and telehealth psychology and psychiatry
  • Family and caregiving benefits including a competitive paid parental leave program as well as supplemental infertility coverage
  • Life, accidental death & dismemberment, short-term disability, and long-term disability insurance
  • Supplemental hospital indemnity, specified disease, and accident coverage
  • Pre-tax commuter benefits including transit and parking
  • Discounted pet, home & auto, and legal insurance

Vince, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant or employee because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, age, or military or veteran status or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Vince, LLC also provides reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with applicable laws.
